name: Central American
description: Central American refers to the indigenous varieties of cannabis (or landraces) that grow natively in this region of the world. Because of this region's latitude and climate, these native landrace strains tend to be sativa in structure and effect.
descriptionPlain: Central American refers to the indigenous varieties of cannabis (or landraces) that grow natively in this region of the world. Because of this region's latitude and climate, these native landrace strains tend to be sativa in structure and effect.

highlightedReviews.text: Moved from Houston, Tx üöÄ San Jos√©, Costa Rica. The capital is where the best ganja scene for sure our here. This stuff is called "creepy" and it's considered their 'premium' vs what the locals call "Rasta" that can be in almost all the beach towns and what is mainly sold to tourist at a high price. Rasta weed is horrible boo boo weed. ‚ò†Ô∏è Creepy however not half bad. A solid high that hits quick and smells good. It DOES have an earthy taste though depending on who you get it from. There are lots of other strains here but it's all underground as pot is still illegal here. You will have to spend a while and make some friends before you get brought in. Brush up on your Spanish! üá®üá∑
